It s officially fall Which means all of the Oscar contenders come out yay !). After a very dissapointing summer movie season we can finally get into the good stuff Kicking it off with t he teamup of Director Clint Eastwood and Tom Hanks What can go wrong. The way Clint Eastwood and his team a pproached this subject was excecuted as best as it could. By showing various perspectives of the landing it gives us the view ers a look at the intensity of the situation and the fear that all of the people involved suffered from. It also does a magnificent job of showing the after effect of the events that took place How they had to rescue the passengers after the plane landing and how the media and the entire world reacted. This movie really needed a strong hero to carry the story and who better than Tom Hanks The fear and a nxiety that he brought to his performance really humanized the c haracter of Sully Adding just the right amount of confidence and defense to his actions he becomes the guy you just want to root for I know I did. The hearing scenes were pretty intense to watch too. Aaron Eckhart really stood out to me. He plays co pilot Jeff Skiles the stand up guy to Sully and the man who carries most of the humor in this movie. Some of the acting from the passengers bothered me just a little They didn t play a huge part in the movie but some of them were a little too ecentric for the type of movie this was. Some flashback sequences that dive into past events felt a little out of place too and didn t feel like it added a lot of drama to the story.. In the end this movie reminds me why biopics are great.
